title: Man 'almost killed' while girlfriend is "thrown like a ragdoll" in brutal attack on birthday night out by bouncers
text:
News Man 'almost killed' while girlfriend is "thrown like a ragdoll" in brutal attack on birthday night out by bouncers WARNING GRAPHIC PICTURES CCTV footage shows the shocking attack when head doorman at the Hype nightclub, Cleethorpes, James Turgoose threw the “devastating blow" Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Doorman's brutal attack which left pubgoer with broken jaw Share this video Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! A pubgoer was 'almost killed' while his girlfriend was "thrown around like a ragdoll" in a brutal attack by bouncers caught on CCTV. 
Martin Wood was out celebrating his girlfriend's birthday but the night ended with him suffering a broken jaw, eye socket and nose. 
The victim claimed doctors said that with another quarter of a centimetre impact of the fracture, he could have been killed. 
Martin Wood was out celebrating when head doorman James Turgoose at the Hype nightclub, Cleethorpes, threw the “devastating blow," reports the Grimbsy Telegraph. The brutal attack left Martin Wood with a broken jaw (Photo: Grimsby telegraph) 
Turgoose had worked as a door supervisor for four years and a stadium steward at Grimsby Town FC's Blundell Park ground. 
CCTV footage of the attack was shown in court and also captured fellow doorman Lee Jenson throw Mr Wood's girlfriend "like a ragdoll" on to the road outside the nightclub. She is seen to bang her head. 
Turgoose, 27, of Waltham, was found guilty of causing grievous bodily harm after a trial at Grimsby Crown Court. 
The jury took less than 35 minutes to return a guilty verdict. The brutal attack was captured on CCTV (Photo: Grimsby telegraph) 
After the hearing, Mr Wood, 30, a former bar manager at Thorp Park, claimed: “The doctors said another quarter of a centimetre impact of the fracture and I could have been killed. 
“My girlfriend was thrown down like a rag doll and banged her head." 
He added: “This sort of behaviour diminishes the image of the resort. I was going out for fun and a dance, not to get involved in a fight. People that do that should be dealt with. Bouncers have a duty of care to everyone." Martin Wood suffered a broken jaw, eye socket and nose (Photo: Grimsby telegraph) 
Turgoose received a 15-month prison sentence suspended for two years. 
He was also ordered to do 300 hours of unpaid work and must pay compensation of £3,000 at a rate of £250 per month towards Mr Wood. Read More 
Judge Kate Buckingham highlighted the significant injuries to Mr Wood. 
She told Turgoose he had a responsibility to care for customers “not to resort to violence". 
“The blow you delivered was forceful and targeted and was far below the standards expected of a door supervisor." 
The judge praised the victim as “generous and magnanimous" in his view to the court that Turgoose “was a decent man who had made a mistake". James Turgoose, 27, of Waltham, was found guilty of causing grievous bodily harm after a trial at Grimsby Crown Court (Photo: Grimsby telegraph) 
The judge said Turgoose should meet his victim under a restorative justice scheme, if Mr Wood is willing. 
She added Turgoose had worked during the day as a bricklayer and at night as a door supervisor. 
She urged him to review his work pattern and the impact so many late nights have on his behaviour. 
Turgoose and his partner are expecting a baby in October, the court heard. 
Prosecuting, Jeremy Evans told the court the incident happened in the early hours of November 6, 2015. 
He showed the CCTV footage at the trial where Turgoose came out of the doorway and launched a single blow to Mr Wood's face causing extensive injuries. 
Mr Wood and his girlfriend had an argument and left the club. The attack was captured on CCTV which shows the victim receiving a "devastating blow" (Photo: Grimsby telegraph) 
Mr Evans said Mr Wood had not been allowed to go back into the nightclub, but his girlfriend had. 
He said: “All he was asking the doorman to do was to look after his girlfriend and make sure she got home safely. 
“The other doorman swung her around like a rag doll. That was Mr Jenson." 
He highlighted the prolonged recovery of the victim who is still troubled by numbness and has trouble sleeping. 
For Turgoose, Jayne Bryan handed in references to the court which described the defendant as “calm and courteous" and a positive good character. 
She said he had never acted this way before or since the violent incident. Martin Wood's girlfriend banged her head in the attack (Photo: Grimsby telegraph) 
She told he had since lost his licence to work as a door supervisor and he was “unlikely to darken the doors of the courtroom ever again". 
After the hearing, senior advocate with the Crown Prosecution Service, Mr Evans said: “This was a brutal attack, captured on CCTV, on a man who simply wanted to ensure his girlfriend got home safely. 
"Turgoose quite deliberately struck the victim with a devastating blow to the face which fractured his jaw, eye socket and nose. Read More Father stabbed to death after beating by gang of 10 thugs - just days after birth of his second child 
“Despite claiming he acted in self-defence, and telling lies about the whole incident, the CCTV footage speaks for itself, and the jury found Turgoose guilty after only 35 minutes' deliberation." 
The judge also ordered Lee Jenson's actions to be referred to the licensing authority to see what advice should be given. Like us on Facebook
